page.title: 11LUDLOW CHURCHES
page.content: On a normal Sunday approximately 800 people meet for Christian worship. Anglicans meet in St. Lawrence Parish church,St.John's,Gravel Hill and St.Giles, Ludford. Roman Catholics meet in St.Peter's, Henley Road. Methodists meet in Broad Street and Zion,New Road. Baptists have a chapel in Rock Lane. Pentecostals use the former Salvation army building in Upper Galdeford. The Society of Friends meet in The Barn, Lower Corve Street. Christadelphians use a room in Brand Lane. The Emmanuel fellowship meet at St.Milburgha,Sheet Road The most recently erected church is the Gospel Hall,Clee View,built 1981.
